intro: Draba alpina var. ochroleuca, commonly known as the white alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 5–20 cm, featuring a basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in alpine meadows and scree slopes, contributing to the biodiversity of these harsh habitats.
